name: v2.4.8
body:
see the full [**changelog**](../../blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v248-2022-01-10)

download the header from [**here**](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/onqtam/doctest/v2.4.8/doctest/doctest.h)

This should be considered a stable version. Starting from this version, tagging of releases will be prefixed with `v` as [suggested here](https://github.com/doctest/doctest/issues/579).

:star: [No longer looking for maintainers!](https://github.com/doctest/doctest/issues/554#issuecomment-1009162545) :star:

This is the Christmas :santa: edition!

download the header from [**here**](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/onqtam/doctest/2.4.4/doctest/doctest.h)

see the full [**changelog**](../../blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#243-2020-12-16)

see the full [**changelog**](../../blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#242-2020-12-15)

download the header from [**here**](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/onqtam/doctest/2.4.2/doctest/doctest.h)

:shipit: Most notable additions:
- Support for unit tests with Open MPI as a new [extension header](https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/blob/master/doc/markdown/extensions.md#distributed-tests-with-mpi) - #413
- Added default printers for enums - closing #121 via PR #429

see the full [**changelog**](../../blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#241-2020-11-04)

download the header from [**here**](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/onqtam/doctest/2.4.1/doctest/doctest.h)

:shipit: New features:
- [JUnit reporter](https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/blob/master/doc/markdown/reporters.md)! see issues #376 and #318 for more details.

:loudspeaker: Other announcements:
- JetBrains have added support for doctest to [CLion](https://blog.jetbrains.com/clion/2020/06/doctest-in-clion/)!
- slow and steady [growth in popularity](https://starcharts.herokuapp.com/onqtam/doctest) - doctest now has [3% market share](https://www.jetbrains.com/lp/devecosystem-2020/cpp/)!

see the full [**changelog**](../../blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#240-2020-06-27)

download the header from [here](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/onqtam/doctest/2.1.0/doctest/doctest.h)

see the [**changelog**](../../blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#201-2018-10-24)

download the header from [here](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/onqtam/doctest/2.0.1/doctest/doctest.h)

The main 4 developments are:

- moved to C++11 - motivated by the results from the poll in [this reddit thread](https://www.reddit.com/r/cpp/comments/8mqpzu/should_c98compatible_libraries_switch_to_c11_for/)
- [thread-safety](https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/blob/master/doc/markdown/faq.md#is-doctest-thread-aware) - asserts and logging utilities can be used in multiple threads spawned from a single test case without race conditions ([thread sanitizer](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ThreadSanitizer.html) tested) - see [example](https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/blob/master/examples/all_features/concurrency.cpp)
- a complete overhaul of the internals of the framework (moving from printf-style logging to streams and changing internal structures) to allow for easier future development (including a reporter interface - work in progress)
- given that doctest is [extremely light on compile times](https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/blob/master/doc/markdown/benchmarks.md#compile-time-benchmarks) and is meant to be used for tests side-by-side with the production code - added the ability for asserts to be used [outside of a testing context](https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/blob/master/doc/markdown/assertions.md#using-asserts-out-of-a-testing-context) (as a general purpose assert library) - [example](https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/blob/master/examples/all_features/asserts_used_outside_of_tests.cpp)

The move to C++11 allowed me to greatly simplify the codebase:

- removed a ton of preprocessor config options/detection for C++11 features (nullptr, deleted/defaulted functions, variadic macros, rvalue references, static assert, override, long long)
- using variadic templates where appropriate - mainly for [templated test cases](https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/blob/master/doc/markdown/parameterized-tests.md#templated-test-cases---parameterized-by-type)
- moved initialization of fields from initializer lists to class bodies
- using range-based for loops
- using lambdas
- using auto
- easily added portable [thread-safety](https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/blob/master/doc/markdown/faq.md#is-doctest-thread-aware)

Moving to C++11 also lead to dropping support for some old compilers:

- MSVC 2008, 2010, 2012, 2013 (supported: 2015+)
- GCC 4.4, 4.5, 4.6, 4.7 (supported: 4.8+)
- Clang 3.3, 3.4 (supported: 3.5+)

Use tag [1.2.9](https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/tree/1.2.9) for C++98 and older compilers.

Checkout the current Travis CI [build matrix](https://travis-ci.org/onqtam/doctest) (and [appveyor](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/onqtam/doctest)) for all supported compilers (still 180+ configurations tested - Debug/Release, address/undefined/thread sanitizers, valgrind, static analysis).

There is also a vaguely [documented](https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/blob/master/doc/markdown/reporters.md) ```doctest::IReporter``` interface for defining custom reporters (xml, TeamCity, whatever) and event listeners (test case started, assert passed, test run ended, etc.) - multiple reporters can be used at the same time.

The reporter system will be finalized for [version 2.1](https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/blob/master/doc/markdown/roadmap.md).

Other developments:
- further improvement of compile and link times
- compilation and runtime [benchmarks](https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/blob/master/doc/markdown/benchmarks.md) were updated
- the project gained a [logo](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/onqtam/doctest/master/scripts/data/logo/logo_1.svg?sanitize=true) thanks to [area55git](https://github.com/area55git)
- support for [clang-cl](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/UsersManual.html#clang-cl)

----------

see the [changelog](../../blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#200-2018-08-23)
